page.title: 16MADELEY STAFFS : ATTITUDES
page.content: In Madeley one's attitudes depend upon one's origins & address.The original Madeley folk resent being outnumbered by newcomers often townees.They feel the village has been urbanised,familiar places have vanished under new housing & the pace of life has increased.There is more vandalism.They no longer know everyone by name & family history.Iron- ically,though appreciate cultural advances & like the greater mobility & social occasions.The newcomers,mostly younger,work elsewhere & are happy to come home to Madeley Â£in the country'. They want very much to belong but they also want to improve things. Madeley Heath people feel too far from the centre.It's a long walk or expens- ive bus ride to pension or doctor.Much of this is inevitable.Villages cannot stay unmoved by events.And villagers are basically friendly & helpful folk.
